title: Philippe Coutinho 'has no future at Barcelona' despite impressive start at Bayern Munich…
text:
Philippe Coutinho does not have a future at Barcelona despite his good form for Bayern Munich, according to Spanish outlet AS.

Coutinho, who made the move to Munich in an August loan deal, has impressed for the German champions, with two goals and three assists in eight games.

Barcelona have not had the greatest of starts themselves and trail rivals Real Madrid in La Liga, but irrespective of that the hierarchy at the Nou Camp do not see a future for Coutinho at the club.

Philippe Coutinho celebrates scoring against Cologne at the Allianz Arena in September

Coutinho has made eight appearances for Bayern so far following his loan move from Barca

PHILIPPE COUTINHO 2019-20 Appearances: 8

Goals: 2

Assists: 3

Yellow cards: 0 Statistics according to Transfermarkt

AS report that Bayern have the option to sign Coutinho at the end of the loan deal for £104million.

Bayern currently pay Coutinho's £11m-a-year wages, on top of an initial £8m fee for the Brazilian.

Coutinho had been expected to make a massive impact at Barcelona having finally completed a £145m move from Liverpool in January 2018.

He started 38 games in total, scored 11 times and provided five assists but never truly managed to win over the Catalan fans, and was made surplus to requirements by Barcelona manager Ernesto Valverde.

Coutinho scored a goal against Man United last season and then put his hands to his ears

Coutinho has immersed himself in the Bayern culture, pictured here at an Oktoberfest festival

The 27-year-old was pushed further down the pecking order in the summer with the arrival of Antoine Griezmann, and the emergence of 16-year-old Ansu Fati in the last couple of months means a return to the club for Coutinho looks unlikely.

Should Bayern not take up the option to sign Coutinho permanently, Barcelona chiefs believe the Premier League would be his most likely destination.

He was linked with a return to Liverpool in the summer, while Chelsea, Tottenham and Manchester United were also rumoured to be keeping an eye on the playmaker.
description: Coutinho, who made the move to Munich in August, has impressed for the German champions, with two goals and three assists in eight games, but still does not seem to have a future at Barcelona.
